your groceries-- and more. Google CEO Eric Schmidt showed off his new phone at the Web 2.0 Summit in San Fransisco. The Washington Post reports, the phone contains the Near Field Communication Chip-- or NFC. The transactions will be completed by tapping a physical point, such as a payment terminal or other objects encoded with the information needed to complete the purchase. This system means phones might soon replace credit cards. Eric Schmidt says, it's more secure than traditional credit card transactions.
